section.p: The following prerequisites must be fulfilled before you can create and publish services in :

ul.li: To create technical services for the AWSOpenStackvSphere integration in , you must have access to as a technology manager. You must be a member of the technology provider organization responsible for the AWSOpenStackVMware service controller as specified in the configuration settings for the installation.

In AWS, appropriate AMIs for virtual servers must exist, to which the technical services in can be mapped. The AWS user specified in the configuration settings for the installation must have the necessary credentials to create and configure virtual servers based on these AMIs.

Templates for the virtual systems to be provisioned must exist. They form the basis for the technical services in .
Templates can be provided by the technology provider organization responsible for the OpenStack service controller by importing the templates into the <codeph>bssapp</codeph> database.
Refer to for details.

li.p: The user specified in the configuration settings for the installation must have the necessary credentials to create and configure virtual systems for your organization based on these templates in OpenStack.
In FUJITSU Cloud Service K5, the cpf_systemowner role is required.

ul.li: In vSphere, appropriate templates for the provisioning of VMs must exist, to which the technical services in can be mapped. The vSphere user specified in the configuration settings for the installation must have the necessary permissions to create and configure VMs based on these templates.

To create marketable services for the AWSOpenStackvSphere integration in , you must have access to as a service manager of an organization with the supplier role. This may be the same organization as the technology provider organization or a different one.
To publish your marketable services, you must have access to an appropriate marketplace in in your service manager role.
